lines.line: Hello.
Hi, I was...
Welcome to the magnificent wonder of the Observatory, where wonder is all around you, where the stars can be clutched from the heavens!
Wow, nice intro.
Why, thanks! How might I help you?
Lost? It must have been those pesky goblins that led you astray.
Head north-east to find the city of Ardougne.
I'm sure I'll find the way.
Thanks for all your help.
No problem at all. Come and visit again!
An Observatory?
Of course. We have a superb telescope up in the Observatory, on the hill.
A truly marvellous invention, the likes of which you'll never behold again.
Well, it would be if it worked.
Don't interrupt!
What? It doesn't work?
Oh, no, no, no. Don't listen to him, he's joking. Aren't you, my FAITHFUL assistant?
Nope, dead serious. Hasn't been working for a long time.
Arghhh! Get back to work and stop sticking your nose in!
So, it's broken. How come?
Oh, I suppose there's no use keeping it secret. Did you see those houses outside?
Up on the hill? Yes, I've seen them.
It's a horde of goblins.
Since they moved here they have caused nothing but trouble.
Last week, my telescope was tampered with.
Now, parts need replacing before it can be used again. They've even been messing around in the dungeons under this area. Something needs to be done.
Strikes me that this visitor could help us.
Stop being so rude.
Although, he has a point. What do you say?
What, me?
Sounds interesting, what can I do for you?
Oh, thanks so much.
I shall need some materials for the telescope, so it can be used again.
Let's start with three planks of wood for the telescope base. My assistant will help with obtaining these, won't you?
As if I don't have enough work to do. Seems I don't have a choice.
Go talk to him if you need some advice.
Okay, I'll be right back.
Oh, sorry, I don't have time for that.
Oh dear. I really do need some help.
If you see anyone who can help then please send them my way.
I'm just passing through.
Fair enough. Not everyone is interested in this place, I suppose.
Can I interrupt you?
I suppose so. Please be quick though.
Might I have a word?
Sure, how can I help you?
Hello there.
Yes?
Can I speak with you?
Why, of course. What is it?
Where can I find planks of wood? I need some for the telescope's base.
I understand planks can be found at Port Khazard, to the east of here. There are some at the Barbarian Outpost, too.
Failing that, you could always ask the Sawmill Operator. He's to the north-east of Varrock, by the Lumber Yard.
I have a plank.
That you do - but if you remember rightly, the professor wanted an ordinary wooden plank, like the ones at Port Khazard.
Oh, I see.
How about this plank I've got here?
I think the professor was after ordinary planks. You should be able to find them at Port Khazard.
I've got a plank.
That's nice.
You know, for the telescope's base.
Well done. Remember that you'll need three in total.
I've got some planks for the telescope's base.
Good work! The professor has been eagerly awaiting them.
Hi again!
It's my helping hand, back again.
Do you have the planks yet?
Sorry, not yet. Three planks was it?
It was indeed.
I've made a start.
Well, you'll need three of them.
I have a plank for you.
That's no good. I asked for ordinary planks. If you can't find out where they are, talk to my assistant.
Sorry.
How about this plank?
I asked for ordinary wooden planks. If you're not sure where to get them, speak to my assistant.
Yes, I've got them. Here they are.
Well done. This will make a big difference.
Now, the bronze for the tube. Oh, assistant!
Okay, okay, ask me if you need any help,.
Hi.
The traveller returns!
Still working hard?
Some of us are.
What did I tell you about speaking when spoken to?
So, you have the bronze bar?
Not yet.
Please bring me one, then.
Can you help me? How do I go about getting a bronze bar?
You'll need to use tin and copper ore on a furnace to produce this metal.
Right you are.
The bronze bar is ready, and waiting for the professor.
He'll surely be pleased. Go ahead and give it to him.
I certainly do. Here you go.
Great. Now all I need is the lens made.
Please get me some molten glass.
Oi! Lazy bones!
What? I'm not lazy.
Not you! I'm talking to my assistant.
Calm down old man, I heard., I'm here if you need any help.
Thank you. Wait a minute, who you calling 'old'?
How are you getting on finding me some molten glass?
Still working on it.
I really need it. Please hurry.
What's the best way for me to get molten glass?
There are many ways, but I'd suggest making it yourself. Get yourself a bucket of sand and some soda ash, which you can get from using seaweed with a furnace. Use the soda ash and sand together in a
furnace and bang - molten glass is all yours. There's a book about it on the table if you want to know more.
Thank you!
I've managed to get hold of some molten glass.
I suggest you have a word with the professor, in that case.
Here it is.
Excellent work, let's make the lens.
It'll need to be made to an exact shape and size.
Well, obviously, hence why we have a lens mould.
Not any more. One of those goblins took it.
Great, just what I need., I don't suppose you could find it?
I'll have a look - where should I start?
No idea. You could ask my USELESS assistant if you want.
What have I done to deserve this?
Did you bring me the mould?
Still looking for it.
Please try and find it; again, my assistant may be able to help.
Where can I find this lens mould you mentioned?
I'm sure I heard one of those goblins talking about it. I bet they've hidden it somewhere. Probably using it for some strange purpose, I'm sure.
What makes you say that?
I had a nice new star chart, until recently. I went out to do an errand for the professor the other day, only to see a goblin using it...
...as some kind of makeshift hankey to blow his nose!
Oh dear.
You may want to look through the dungeon they have under their little village.
Thanks for the advice.
I found a key.
Perhaps it unlocks something.
Oh, thanks. Great advice.
Look. I found this.
A key?
Exactly.
To what?
Well, I don't know. Perhaps some amazing treasure!
I doubt it.
Look, I found this!
It doesn't look much like a lens mould.
What? No. It's a key!
To what?
Well,I don't really know yet.
No, but I found a key.
Interesting. You might be onto something there. Keep looking.
Will do, thanks.
You had better be quick, there may be more guards about.
I have the lens mould.
Well done on finding that! I am honestly quite impressed. Make sure you take it straight to the professor.
Will do.
I certainly have. You'll never guess what they were doing with it.
Well, from the smell I'd guess cooking some vile concoction.
Wow, good guess. Well, here you go.
Please don't give that to him. Last time he tried any Crafting, I had to spend a week cleaning up after the explosion.
Explosion?
Erm, yes. I think in this instance you had probably better do it.
I suppose it's better I don't ask.
You can use the mould with molten glass to make a new lens.
Hold on a second. I don't have space to carry it all.
Hurry and free up some space, then.
Is the lens finished?
How do I make it again?
Use the molten glass with the mould.
Huh. Simple.
How should I make this lens?
Just use the molten glass with the mould. Simple.
Thanks!
Do you like this lens? Good, huh?
Nice. What's that scratch?
Oh, erm, that's a feature.
Yes, that's it! Indubitably, it facilitates the triangulation of photonic illumination to the correct...
Stop! You can't confuse me with big words. Just pray the professor doesn't notice.
Yes, here it is. You may as well take this mould too.
Wonderful, at last I can fix the telescope.
Would you accompany me to the Observatory? You simply must see the telescope in operation.
Sounds interesting. Count me in.
Superb. You'll have to go via the dungeon under the goblin settlement, seeing as the bridge is broken. You'll find stairs up to the Observatory from there.
Okay. See you there.
Hello again.
Ah, it's the telescope repairman! The professor is waiting for you in the Observatory.
How can I get to the Observatory?
Well, since the bridge was ruined, you will have to travel through the dungeon under the goblins' settlement.
Hi, professor!
Oh, hi there.
I'm just adding the finishing touches.
Okay, don't let me interrupt.
Thank you.
Right, let's get this finished.
, I'm just going upstairs to finish off.
Right-oh.
Looking good.
Welcome back.
Hi, this really is impressive.
Certainly is. Please, take a look through the telescope and tell me what you see.
I've had a look through the telescope.
What did you see? If you're not sure, you can find out by looking at the star charts dotted around the walls downstairs.
It was...
Aquarius!
That's exactly it!
Yes! Woo hoo!
That's Aquarius, the water-bearer.
It seems suitable, then, to award you with water runes!
By Saradomin's earlobes! You must be a friend of the gods indeed.
Look in your backpack for your reward, in payment for your work.
Have you got some space for your reward?
Reward? Oh, no, I haven't.
Come see me again when you have a few free spaces in your inventory.
I'm afraid not. Have another look. Remember, you can check the star charts on the walls for reference.
Capricorn!
That's Capricorn, the goat.
Capricorn will surely reward your insight with an increase to your Strength.
Sagittarius!
That's Sagittarius, the centaur.
As you've spotted the archer, I shall reward you with a maple longbow.
Scorpio!
That's Scorpio, the scorpion.
I think weapon poison would make a suitable reward.
Libra!
That's Libra, the scales.
Hmmm, balance, law, order - I shall award you with law runes!
Virgo!
That's Virgo, the virtuous.
Virgo will surely provide you with an increase to Defence.
Leo!
That's Leo, the lion.
I think the majestic power of the lion will raise your Hitpoints.
Cancer!
That's Cancer, the crab.
An armoured creature - I think I shall reward you with an amulet of protection.
Gemini!
That's Gemini, the twins.
With the double nature of Gemini, I can't offer you anything more suitable than a two-handed weapon.
Taurus!
That's Taurus, the bull.
This Strength potion should be a suitable reward.
Aries!
That's Aries, the ram.
A fierce fighter. I'm sure he'll look down on you and improve your Attack for such insight.
Pisces!
That's Pisces, the fish.
What's more suitable as a reward than some tuna?

characters.name: Observatory assistant
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, meek and slightly sardonic tone. A put-upon assistant who follows orders but quietly resents his demanding employer, occasionally letting dry sarcasm slip through.

characters.name: Observatory professor
characters.description: Elderly male, refined British accent, pompous and theatrical tone. A passionate astronomer who speaks with grandiose flourishes about the stars but is quick-tempered and dismissive toward his assistant.
